intro: Lindernia lemuriana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, upright stems and clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, which bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light, making it a popular houseplant. Its ability to produce multiple blooms makes it a favorite among gardeners and plant enthusiasts.
